|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Qualcomm Atheros;QCA9880-2R4E;QCA9880-2R4E; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad2ac = 1300 |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== {{WiFiCert|WFA20452|12/27/2013}}
Per the FCC photos... *"WAPAC02" is silkscreened on the top of the board. *"8WAPAC02.1A1G" is silkscreened on the bottom of the board. *The [[QCA]] WiSoC is a QCA9558-AT4A (3T3R 802.11bgn) *The [[QCA]] 5 GHz radio is a QCA9880-2R4E (QCA9880 v2?) :The 5GHz radio is using three [[Skyworks]] (''SiGe'') [http://www.cdiweb.com/ProductDetail/SE5023L-Skyworks-Solutions-Inc/74438/ SE5023L] :5GHz Power Amplifier w/ Power Detectors (26dBm) *The [[QCA]] GbE Switch is a QCA8334-2L3E *The PoE injector board has "PE03G V1.3 2012-08-24" silkscreened on it.
The power adapter shown in the FCC external photos is an ''unbranded'' :MU24-B1480-A30S (design no.) / MU24-B480050-A1 (model no.) :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 1.0A -> 48VDC, 0.5A). The device is assumed to use 802.3af compatible PoE.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
